page.title: 08THE PORT OF GOOLE
page.content: Goole is Britain's most inland port - some 50 miles from the North Sea. In April 1985, Associated British Ports announced that the Humber Ports made a{profit}of Â£7.7million with Goole "performing very well".It reported that there was more business in '84 than '83. Both{steel}exports and{grain}imports were higher. The opening of the{container}terminal in January '84 had more than doubled traffic. Unfortunately, the national docks and miner's{strikes}both affected the port in 1984. This year, Associated British Ports announced that the dock's{police}force which had existed for 120 years was to be discontinued. This caused concern that the docks would be less secure, {smuggling}would increase and the risk of{rabies}entering the country would be greater.
